intro: Freycinetia vulgaris, commonly known as the common freycinetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange or red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic leaves. Freycinetia vulgaris is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
